1.text: Put a steamer basket in a large pot with a tight-fitting lid.

2.text: Add 2 inches (5.1 cm) of cold water to the pot and bring it to a boil.

3.text: Cut the lobster tails down the center and remove the vein.

4.text: Place the lobster tails in the steamer basket and cook for 4-12 minutes.

5.text: Remove the lobster tails with tongs.

6.text: Serve the lobster tails with drawn butter.

7.text: Preheat the oven to 350 °F (177 °C) and melt 1 stick of butter.

8.text: Use kitchen shears to cut the shell and remove the vein.

9.text: Place the tails on a baking sheet and brush them with melted butter.

10.text: Bake them for 15 minutes or until the tails reach 140–145 °F (60–63 °C).

11.text: Remove the lobster tails and serve them with lemon slices.

12.text: Preheat the grill to medium heat.

13.text: Cut the lobster tail with kitchen shears and remove the vein.

14.text: Brush the tails with olive oil, then add salt.

15.text: Cook the tails cut-side-down for 5 minutes then turn them over.

16.text: Brush the meat with butter and grill the tails for another 5 minutes.

17.text: Remove the tails from the grill and serve them with lemon wedges.
